revised_title: On the Law of Atmospheric Resistance to Rifled Projectiles
tldr: The author investigates the law of atmospheric resistance to rifled projectiles using data from Colonel Halford's experiments with Metford's match-rifle. By assuming a resistance varying as the cube of the velocity, the author finds a near-perfect agreement with the results of observation, confirming previous work by Professor Hülle and Professor Bashforth.
